オプション1: Star Man returned to the ruins.
"A-are you okay...?!"
Seeing Star Man's wounds, Trapezoid Man panicked.
"It's pretty bad, but I don't think... it's life-threatening."
"I-I see..."
Triangle Man and Square Man were speechless at Star Man's wounds.
Star Man told Trapezoid Man and the others what had happened today.
"This is the map."
Star Man spread out the map and they all looked at it.

"We're probably around here.
The place with the coconut trees seems to be called 'Sinkhat Coast.'"

"I wonder if ships ever come to Prolitan Island.
When I was looking into going to Optipul Island,
I checked a bit and I don't think there were any ships to Prolitan."
"About that... how about we build a boat and try to escape?"
"Huh?"

"In my case there's the 'within a year' thing, so I have no choice.
As for the rest of you, it might be better to stay here and wait for rescue."
"That's a tough call..."
"Hmm. That's a hard choice—really an ultimatum between two options."

"I've never done it, but building a four‑person boat
is probably far harder than building a one‑person one."
"True."

"I think the most realistic plan is
I build a one‑person boat, go to the Republic of GEFORQE,
get another boat, and come back."
"Let's do that."

"Oh, and that red fruit we soaked in the river water—
I tried eating it and it was fine."
"Good. Then our food situation will improve a lot."
That night,
Star Man couldn't sleep from the pain of his dissolved skin.
(What do I do from here... This is bad. I can't move.)
"Ugh... guh..."
Gritting his teeth through the agony, Star Man sat up.
"Hey... come here a sec..."
He called to the children who had been watching him.
"As you can see, I won't be able to move for a while."
"We'll be fine."
"Yeah."
"I think I can walk in about three days. Until then, please handle gathering food."
"We do that all the time, so it's fine."
"Thanks."
Three days later,

Even after three days, Star Man still couldn't walk properly.
After that, for a month he devoted himself to making bows and arrows and training magic.
With the two adults unable to move, the two children kept them alive.
Because they'd found a way to detoxify the red fruit, they were able to secure enough food not to die.

Star Man and Trapezoid Man worked together to make bows and arrows from branches and vines around the house.
With no blades, they made them only with stones; they looked plainly like branches.
Still, they seemed somewhat practical—better than throwing arrows by hand.

The children wanted them too, so they made four and each took one.
Soon target practice became a fad, and they competed.
Star Man decided to start collecting materials for a boat.

Even after a month, Star Man's burns hadn't healed; every movement reopened the wounds,
and yellow fluid seeped from them.

Fortunately, only a little acid had hit his elbows and knees,
so if he endured it he could still move his limbs.
With a one‑year time limit, he had to force himself to move.

Along with gathering boat materials,
Star Man decided to try heading to Ubuntu Cave once more.
